resources.string: Flat Bench Press - 3 sets of 10/12 reps
Incline Bench Press - 3 sets of 10/12 reps
Decline Bench Press - 3 sets of 10/12 reps
Incline Chest Press Machine - 3 sets of 10/12 reps
Pec Dec Fly - 3 sets of 10/12 reps
Walk on the treadmill for 15 minutes at a moderate pace.
Assisted Pull Ups - 3 sets of 10/12 reps
Dumbell Curls - 2 sets of 10/12 reps (Warm up Sets, choose moderate weights)
Incline Dumbell Curls - 3 sets of 10/12 reps
Reverse Cable Curls - 3 sets of 10/12 reps
2 Sets of Diamond Push Ups (Warm up)
Overhead Triceps Extension (Single Hand with dumbell) - 3 sets of 10/12 reps
Overhead Triceps Extension (Both Hands with dumbell) - 3 sets of 10/12 reps
Bar Push Down - 3 sets of 10/12 reps
Free Squats - 2 sets of 15 reps (Warm up)
Seated Leg Curls - 3 sets of 10/12 reps
Dumbell Shoulder Press - 2 sets of 12 reps (Warm up)
Behind The Neck Shoulder Press - 3 sets of 10/12 reps
Dumbell Front Raises - 3 sets of 10/12 reps
Seated Reverse Fly - 3 sets of 10/12 reps

Contrary to popular belief, a rest day isn’t about being lazy on the couch. It’s during this time that the beneficial effects of exercise take place. Specifically, rest is essential for muscle growth.Also, your muscles store carbohydrates in the form of glycogen. During exercise, your body breaks down glycogen to fuel your workout. Rest gives your body time to replenish these energy stores before your next workout.
